stage.name: Stage1
stage.code:
Const olMailItem As Long = 0
Const olFormatHTML As Long = 2 Const olFormatPlain As Long = 1 Const olFormatRichText As Long = 3 Const olFormatUnspecified As Long = 0
' The 'selected' instance of Outlook. ' This is updated on any access of an instance (either adding a new ' instance or getting one) ' Private CurrentInstance As Object
' Map of instances keyed against the handles which represent them. ' Private HandleMap As Dictionary(Of Integer, Object)
' Map of handles keyed against the instances they represent. ' Here to ensure we don't assign multiple handles to a single ' instance and bring about a memory leak ' Private InstanceMap As Dictionary(Of Object, Integer)
' Constructor - this just initialises the collections which map ' the Outlook instances to handles and vice versa. Public Sub New()
Me.HandleMap = New Dictionary(Of Integer, Object)() Me.InstanceMap = New Dictionary(Of Object, Integer)()
End Sub
' Gets the handle for a given instance ' ' If the instance is not yet held, then it is added to the ' map and a handle is assigned to it. It is also set as the ' 'current' instance, accessed with a handle of zero in the ' below methods. ' ' Either way, the handle which identifies the instance is returned ' ' @param Instance The instance for which a handle is required ' ' @return The handle of the instance Protected Function GetHandle(Instance As Object) As Integer If Instance Is Nothing Then Throw New ArgumentNullException("Tried to add an empty instance") End If
' Check if we already have this instance - if so, return it. If InstanceMap.ContainsKey(Instance) Then CurrentInstance = Instance Return InstanceMap(Instance) End If
Dim key as Integer For key = 1 to Integer.MaxValue If Not HandleMap.ContainsKey(key) HandleMap.Add(key, Instance) InstanceMap.Add(Instance, key) Me.CurrentInstance = Instance Return key End If Next key Return 0 End Function
' Gets the instance corresponding to the given handle, setting ' the instance as the 'current' instance for future calls ' ' A value of 0 will provide the 'current' instance, which ' is set each time an instance is added or accessed. ' ' This will return Nothing if the given handle does not ' correspond to a registered instance, or if the current ' instance was closed and the reference has not been updated. ' ' @param Handle The handle representing the instance required, ' or zero to get the 'current' instance. Protected Function GetInstance(Handle As Integer) As Object
Dim Instance As Object = Nothing
If Handle = 0 Then If CurrentInstance Is Nothing Then Create_Instance(Handle, "") End If Return CurrentInstance End If
Instance = HandleMap(Handle) If Not Instance Is Nothing Then CurrentInstance = Instance End If Return Instance
End Function
Public Function GetDataTable(ByVal ColumnNamesCSV As String, ByVal ColumnTypesCSV As String) As DataTable
Dim objTable As DataTable Dim objColumn As DataColumn Dim aColumnNames As String() = ColumnNamesCSV.Split(",") Dim aColumnTypes As String() = ColumnTypesCSV.Split(",")
Try objTable = New DataTable For i As Integer = 0 To aColumnNames.Length - 1 objColumn = New DataColumn objColumn.DataType = System.Type.GetType(aColumnTypes(i).Trim) objColumn.ColumnName = aColumnNames(i).Trim objTable.Columns.Add(objColumn) Next
Catch e As Exception objTable = nothing End Try
Return objTable
End Function
Public Function RecurseFolder(ByVal CurrentFolder As Object, ByVal CurrentPath As String, ByRef FolderTable As DataTable) Dim Subfolder As Object Dim FolderPath As Object = CurrentPath & "\" & CurrentFolder.Name Dim objRow As DataRow objRow = FolderTable.NewRow() objRow("Folder Name") = FolderPath
FolderTable.Rows.Add(objRow) For Each SubFolder in CurrentFolder.Folders RecurseFolder(SubFolder, FolderPath, FolderTable) Next End Function
Public Function RecurseSearchForFolder(ByVal SearchFolderPath As Object, ByVal CurrentFolder As Object, ByVal CurrentPath As String) As Object Dim Subfolder As Object Dim CurSubfolder As Object Dim FolderPath As Object = CurrentPath & "\" & CurrentFolder.Name Dim compareResult As Integer compareResult = StrComp(SearchFolderPath, FolderPath)
If compareResult = 0 Return CurrentFolder End If
For Each SubFolder in CurrentFolder.Folders CurSubFolder = RecurseSearchForFolder(SearchFolderPath, SubFolder, FolderPath) If Not CurSubFolder is Nothing return CurSubFolder End If Next
Return Nothing End Function

stage.name: Note1
stage.narrative:
Clean Up Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some finalisation (or "cleanup") tasks as your business object is closed down.
The cleanup action will be called automatically immediately after closing your business object at the end of a business process.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than before the disposal of the business object.

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative:
Initialise Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some initialisation tasks after your business object is loaded.
The initialise action will be called automatically immediately after loading your business object.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than after the creation of the object.

stage.name: Create Instance
stage.code:
Dim outlook as Object = CreateObject("Outlook.Application")
If ProfileName = "" Then ' Do nothing Else Dim oNS as Object = outlook.getNamespace("MAPI") ONS.Logon(ProfileName, "", True, True) End If
handle = GetHandle(outlook)

stage.name: Detach Instance
stage.code: Dim app As Object = GetInstance(handle) HandleMap.Remove(CInt(handle)) InstanceMap.Remove(app) If app Is CurrentInstance Then CurrentInstance = Nothing Marshal.ReleaseComObject(app)

stage.name: Check Handle
stage.code: ' Just ensure that the handle references a valid instance HandleMissing = (GetInstance(handle) is Nothing)

exception.detail: "Handle: " & [handle] & " does not correspond to an Word Instance"

stage.name: Exit
stage.code:
Dim app As Object = GetInstance(handle) app.Quit()
Me.HandleMap.Remove(handle) Me.InstanceMap.Remove(app)

stage.name: ShowInstance
stage.code:
Const olMinimized As Long = 1 Const olMaximized As Long = 2 Const olFolderInbox As Long = 6
Dim outlook as Object outlook = GetInstance(handle)
outlook.Session.GetDefaultFolder(olFolderInbox).Display outlook.ActiveExplorer.WindowState = olMaximized

stage.name: Create New Mail Item
stage.code:
' .To = "Alias@domain.com" ' .CC= "Alias2@domain.com" ' .BCC = "Alias3@domain.com" ' .Subject = "This is the subject" ' .Categories = "Test" ' .VotingOptions = "Yes;No;Maybe;" ' .BodyFormat = olFormatPlain ' send plain text message ' .Importance = olImportanceHigh ' .Sensitivity = olConfidential ' .Attachments.Add ("path-to-file.docx")
Dim outlook as Object outlook = GetInstance(handle)
Dim myItem as Object myItem = outlook.CreateItem(olMailItem) myItem.BodyFormat = olFormatRichText myItem.To = toText myItem.Subject = subjectText
Dim aString as String = Replace(messageText, "{Enter}", vbCrLf) myItem.Body = aString
If ccText = "" Then ' Do nothing Else myItem.CC = ccText End If
If attachmentFilePath = "" Then ' Nothing to do Else myItem.Attachments.Add(attachmentFilePath) End If
'myItem.Display myItem.Send

stage.name: Create New Mail Item with Attachment

input.name: filename
input.narrative: The filename to check to ensure it exists.

stage.name: Check need to check for attachment
Get Folder
stage.code:
Dim outlook as Object Dim objTable As DataTable Dim Folder As Object Dim TargetFolder As Object = Nothing
outlook = GetInstance(handle)
Dim Folders as Object = outlook.Session.Folders
objTable = GetDataTable( _ "Folder Name", _ "System.String," )
For Each Folder in Folders If TargetFolder is Nothing TargetFolder = RecurseSearchForFolder(folderPath, Folder, "") End If Next
If TargetFolder is Nothing FolderFound = False Else FolderFound = True Dim mailItemTable As DataTable Dim mailItem As Object
mailItemTable = GetDataTable( _ "EntryID," _ & "Subject," _ & "Sender," _ & "Body," _ & "ReceivedTime," _ & "Unread", _ "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.Boolean")
For Each mailItem in TargetFolder.Items Dim mailItemRow As DataRow If FetchUnreadOnly If Not mailItem.UnRead Goto NextIteration End If End If mailItemRow = mailItemTable.NewRow() mailItemRow("EntryID") = mailItem.EntryID mailItemRow("Subject") = mailItem.Subject mailItemRow("Body") = mailItem.Body mailItemRow("Sender") = mailItem.SenderName mailItemRow("ReceivedTime") = mailItem.ReceivedTime mailItemRow("Unread") = mailItem.UnRead mailItemTable.Rows.Add(mailItemRow) NextIteration: Next
MailList = mailItemTable End If
For Each Folder in Folders RecurseFolder(Folder, "", objTable) Next
FolderList = objTable

stage.name: Save Attachment for Email Entry ID
Save Attachments
stage.code:
Dim outlook as Object Dim Folder As Object Dim TargetFolder As Object = Nothing Dim Attachments As Object = Nothing Dim objTable As DataTable
objTable = GetDataTable( _ "AttachmentFileName", _ "System.String," )
outlook = GetInstance(handle)
Dim Folders as Object = outlook.Session.Folders
For Each Folder in Folders If TargetFolder is Nothing TargetFolder = RecurseSearchForFolder(folderPath, Folder, "") End If Next
EmailFound = False
If TargetFolder is Nothing FolderFound = False Else FolderFound = True Dim mailItem As Object
For Each mailItem in TargetFolder.Items Dim compareResult As Integer compareResult = StrComp(EntryID, mailItem.EntryID) If compareResult = 0 EmailFound = True Attachments = mailItem.Attachments Dim Attachment As Object For each Attachment in Attachments Attachment.SaveAsFile(SaveAttachmentPath & Attachment.FileName) Dim AttachmentRow As DataRow AttachmentRow = objTable.NewRow() AttachmentRow("AttachmentFileName") = Attachment.FileName objTable.Rows.Add(AttachmentRow) Next ListOfAttachments = objTable Goto ExitIteration End If Next ExitIteration: End If

stage.name: Create New HTML Mail Item
stage.code:
' .To = "Alias@domain.com" ' .CC= "Alias2@domain.com" ' .BCC = "Alias3@domain.com" ' .Subject = "This is the subject" ' .Categories = "Test" ' .VotingOptions = "Yes;No;Maybe;" ' .BodyFormat = olFormatPlain ' send plain text message ' .Importance = olImportanceHigh ' .Sensitivity = olConfidential ' .Attachments.Add ("path-to-file.docx")
Dim outlook as Object outlook = GetInstance(handle)
Dim myItem as Object myItem = outlook.CreateItem(olMailItem) myItem.BodyFormat = olFormatHTML myItem.To = toText myItem.Subject = subjectText myItem.HTMLBody = messageHTML
If ccText = "" Then ' Do nothing Else myItem.CC = ccText End If
If attachmentFilePath = "" Then ' Nothing to do Else myItem.Attachments.Add(attachmentFilePath) End If
'myItem.Display myItem.Send

input.name: filename
input.narrative: The filename to check to ensure it exists.

stage.name: Check need to check for attachment
Convert Saved Mail Item To PDF
Convert To PDF (Saved Mail Item)
stage.code:
Dim outlook As Object Dim Item As Object
outlook = GetInstance(handle) Item = outlook.CreateItemFromTemplate(Input_File_Path) 'Item.Display
Dim sName As String Dim sChr As String = "" sName = Item.Subject sName = Replace(sName, "/", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "\", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, ":", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "?", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, Chr(34), sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "<", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, ">", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "|", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "&", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "%", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "*", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, " ", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "{", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "[", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "]", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "}", sChr) sName = Replace(sName, "!", sChr)
Dim outputFolderPath As String If Output_Folder_Path.EndsWith("\") Then outputFolderPath = Output_Folder_Path Else outputFolderPath = Output_Folder_Path + "\" End If
const olMHTML As Integer = 10 Dim interimFilePath = outputFolderPath + sName + ".mht" Item.SaveAs(interimFilePath, olMHTML)
Dim wrdApp As Object Dim wrdDoc As Object wrdApp = CreateObject("Word.Application") wrdDoc = wrdApp.Documents.Open(FileName:=interimFilePath, Visible:=True)
Dim strToSaveAs As String = outputFolderPath + sName + ".pdf" const wdExportFormatPDF As Integer = 17 const wdExportOptimizeForPrint As Integer = 0 const wdExportAllDocument As Integer = 0 const wdExportDocumentContent As Integer = 0 const wdExportCreateNoBookmarks As Integer = 0
wrdApp.ActiveDocument.ExportAsFixedFormat(OutputFileName:= _ strToSaveAs, ExportFormat:=wdExportFormatPDF, _ OpenAfterExport:=False, OptimizeFor:=wdExportOptimizeForPrint, _ Range:=wdExportAllDocument, From:=0, To:=0, Item:= _ wdExportDocumentContent, IncludeDocProps:=True, KeepIRM:=True, _ CreateBookmarks:=wdExportCreateNoBookmarks, DocStructureTags:=True, _ BitmapMissingFonts:=True, UseISO19005_1:=False)
wrdApp.Quit outlook.Quit
Interim_File_Path = interimFilePath

stage.name: Delete Interim File
stage.code: If System.IO.File.Exists(Interim_File_Path) = True Then System.IO.File.Delete(Interim_File_Path) End If

stage.name: Get Email Content As Collection
stage.code:
Dim objOutlook As Object = GetInstance(handle) Dim objNamespace As Object = objOutlook.GetNamespace("MAPI") Dim objMailItem As Object = objNamespace.GetItemFromID(Entry_ID) Dim objInspector As Object = objMailItem.GetInspector
Dim objWordDocument As Object = objInspector.WordEditor If Not (objWordDocument Is Nothing) Then Dim tableCount As Integer = objWordDocument.Tables.Count If tableCount = 1 Then Dim objTable As Object = objWordDocument.Tables(1) objTable.Range.Copy
Dim data As String = Clipboard.GetDataObject().GetData(DataFormats.Text, True)
'The data split into rows Dim asRows() As String = Split(data, vbCrLf) Dim table As New DataTable()
'Set a flag indicating the header row Dim isHeaderRow As Boolean = True
For Each strRow As String In asRows If Not String.IsNullOrEmpty(strRow) Then
Dim fields() As String = Split(strRow, vbTab) If isHeaderRow Then isHeaderRow = False For Each field As String in fields table.Columns.Add(field) Next Else Dim row as DataRow = table.NewRow() For i As Integer = 0 To fields.Length - 1 If i < fields.Length Then row(i) = fields(i) Else row(i) = "" End If Next I table.Rows.Add(row) End If End If Next Data_Collection = table End if End if

input.name: Collection In
input.narrative: The collection to remove empty rows from

output.name: Collection Out
output.narrative: The collection with the empty rows removed

stage.name: Get Table From Body As Collection
Get Table From Body As Collection
stage.code:
Dim data As String = Body_Text.Trim() data = data.Replace(vbCrLf, "[:]") data = data.Replace("[:][:]", "[:]")
'The data split into rows Dim asRows() As String = Split(data, "[:]") Dim table As New DataTable() Dim row As DataRow = table.NewRow()
'Set a flag indicating the header row Dim isHeaderRow As Boolean = True Dim i As Integer = 0
For Each strRow As String In asRows If Not String.IsNullOrEmpty(strRow) Then If (i >= Number_of_Columns) AND isHeaderRow Then isHeaderRow = False i = 0 End If
If isHeaderRow AND strRow <> " " Then table.Columns.Add(strRow) Else row(i) = strRow End If i = i + 1 End If Next table.Rows.Add(row) Data_Collection = table
xx = data

stage.name: Move Mail Item To Mail Folder
stage.code:
Dim objOutlook As Object = GetInstance(handle) Dim objNamespace As Object = objOutlook.GetNamespace("MAPI") Dim objInbox As Object = objNamespace.GetDefaultFolder(6) Dim objDestFolder As Object = objInbox.Folders(Destination_Folder_Name) Dim objMailItem As Object = objNamespace.GetItemFromID(Entry_ID)
objMailItem.Move(objDestFolder)
